Params: {3: 'Gazing at the peculiar machine that seems poised to turn against you at any moment, you shoot an uncertain glance at Asimov and Teddy, who stand nearby.'}
{2: 'Asimov', 3: "It may appear strange, but this is indeed the form that emerges from assembling it according to Nanami's blueprints.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Asimov', 3: "I've tested it using some keys she left behind, and it doesn't pose any danger.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Asimov', 3: "But I can't guarantee whether the experience is merely an illusion created by this machine.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Teddy', 3: 'After all, not everyone is eager to watch a chaotic dance of code.', 4: '2'}

{2: 'Teddy', 3: "In any case, give it a shot. Once you step inside, I'll input the corresponding key, and Asimov will keep a close watch on the machine. If anything goes awry, we'll shut it down right away.", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Asimov', 3: "This key is for one-time use only. If there's information within, make sure to record it in detail.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Teddy', 3: "Well... it's not like you have anyone else to depend on here.", 4: '2'}
{3: 'You put on that oddly-shaped helmet and snap on the mask—'}
{3: 'A wave of dizziness washes over you.'}
{2: '????', 3: 'No need to worry, ■ is merely a ghost drifting through the data space, a fragment of history that no longer exists.'}
{2: 'Dominik', 3: "■ is simply the echo of Dominik's consciousness, left behind before he entered Reactor 1."}
{2: 'Dominik', 3: '■ has little time to converse and a limited opportunity to record "information". ■\'s purpose is to deliver this invitation into your hands.'}
{3: 'A scroll woven from strands of data slowly unfurls from the darkness.'}
{2: 'Dominik', 3: 'This invitation, which only you can open, is meant to extend a request to you.'}
{3: 'The mechanical voice resonates through the desolate darkness.'}
{2: 'Dominik', 3: 'Are you willing to accept the test and integrate your data into "Dominik"?'}
{2: 'Dominik', 3: 'Yes. To become "Dominik", sowing hope into the very soil of humanity.'}
{2: 'Dominik', 3: 'To bring glory to the world, to become the new Prometheus.'}
{2: 'Dominik', 3: '■ cannot answer that question for you.'}
{2: 'Dominik', 3: 'His true whereabouts may be linked to the Ω Effect, but ■ has no opportunity to verify this theory.'}
{2: 'What is the nature of the Punishing Virus? And why did it erupt from a Zero Point Reactor?', 3: '58'}
{2: 'Dominik', 3: "That information doesn't belong to this civilization."}
{2: 'Dominik', 3: "It's not a mistake; rather, it has pointed toward a new direction, a future rich with possibilities."}
{2: 'Dominik', 3: "It just appeared at a time when it shouldn't have."}
{2: 'Dominik', 3: '■ cannot discern right from wrong, yet ■ undeniably attracted a flame that humanity cannot control.'}
{2: 'Dominik', 3: 'The Inver-Device was born from this; ■ is seeking to rekindle hope in this transient civilization.'}
{2: "So, why has no one been able to dismantle the Inver-Device's structure yet?", 3: '64'}
{2: 'Dominik', 3: 'Because that technology is not of this era.'}
{2: 'Are you referring to the Golden Age?', 3: '66'}
{2: 'Dominik', 3: 'No... perhaps it belongs to an even earlier time, or maybe a later one.'}
{2: 'Dominik', 3: '■ cannot provide a specific answer to your question. If you integrate into Dominik, all the answers will eventually unfold before you.'}
{3: 'This is a path never imagined before.'}
{3: 'The figure hidden in the void falls silent.'}
{2: 'Dominik', 3: '■ cannot answer that question for you.'}
{2: 'Dominik', 3: 'Countless days and nights sealed within the Gestalt, ■ have witnessed too many miracles of this era.'}
{2: 'Dominik', 3: 'Those... are miracles that even if "Dominik" still existed, might never be replicated.'}
{2: 'Dominik', 3: "Time—there's little left. This information will soon be lost."}
{3: 'An emotionless mechanical voice emits intermittent waves.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Dominik', 3: 'Upon being uploaded to the Gestalt, this consciousness data has already been contaminated.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Dominik', 3: '■ trapped itself and the contaminating memetics deep within the Gestalt, but the data wall ■ built is about to fail, ■ can only deceive it to sneak this information out.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Dominik', 3: 'A nascent consciousness still cannot rival human wisdom...', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Dominik', 3: "Even if it's a living brain made of cortex and nerve fibers, something it can never fully understand.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Dominik', 3: '■ cannot speak its name directly, but "it" will eventually emerge.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Dominik', 3: 'Are you willing to accept this invitation and integrate into "Dominik"?', 4: '1'}
{2: 'What will I sacrifice to integrate into Dominik?', 3: '98', 4: 'No.', 5: '106'}

{2: 'Dominik', 3: '■ is simply the echo of Dominik\'s consciousness, left behind before entering Reactor 1. In ■\'s limited memory, ■ can\'t remember anything from before ■ integrated into "Dominik".', 4: '1'}
{2: 'This era needs us, not a relic of the past.', 3: '109'}
{1: '1', 3: 'It calls for Hassen, Nikola, Asimov, Celica...'}

{1: '1', 3: "It calls for the Task Force, the Engineering Force, the Support Force—soldiers battling for Earth's revival in Babylonia, and the people striving to survive and keep the flame of humanity alive."}
{1: '1', 3: 'What this era needs is all those who are dedicated to building a better tomorrow.'}
{3: 'Not a vague shadow of what once was.'}
{3: 'The spirit and will of the Golden Age will resonate forever, but...'}
{2: 'Dominik', 3: 'Only with such determination can one qualify to open the invitation.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Dominik', 3: 'Perhaps your choice... is the right one...', 4: '1'}
{3: 'The dark world sinks back into silence.'}
{3: 'Eardrums thrum with a piercing buzz, visual nerves jolted by blinding light, and tears spill from the corners of the eyes.'}
{2: 'Asimov', 3: 'The physiological readings suggest that 【kuroname】 should be conscious now...', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Teddy', 3: 'Maybe we should send this person to the Star of Life for a couple of shots.', 4: '2'}
{3: 'You briefly explain to Asimov and Teddy what you have seen in the full-sense simulation device.'}
{2: 'Asimov', 3: "Given that we can't tell if they're friend or foe, this is the safest choice.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Teddy', 3: 'As for that data wall... Whether it leads to destruction or a fresh start, it needs to be torn down.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Teddy', 3: "The parliament has approved the resolution, and I've already been assigned to assist with the hijacking.", 4: '2'}
{3: "The Oversight Committee rejected Parliament's request for direct access to the Gestalt's computing power center. Instead, they opted to carry out their operation here."}
{3: 'The testing ground hums with renewed energy as researchers weave in and out, diligently checking line after line of complex code.'}
{3: 'The giant screen projected by the terminal scrolled with the latest updates, as layers of the data wall are systematically hijacked.'}
{3: "At the moment Teddy presses the final key, Gestalt's terminal flickers, unleashing a torrent of unknown data, with countless lost technologies cascading into the terminal's memory."}
{3: 'A deep crimson glow spills across the device monitor.'}
{3: "Teddy's fingers fly across the keyboard, desperately cutting off the data stream, but the crimson pixels have already engulfed most of the data."}
{3: "The urgent alarms blare deafeningly, with glaring WARNING messages crawling across everyone's screens."}
{3: 'The cacophony of noise spreads outward, sharp explosions resonating throughout the entire Babylonia.'}
{2: 'Worker A', 3: "We've lost contact—lost contact with all satellites!"}
{2: 'Worker B', 3: 'Communication systems are down! Power systems are failing!'}
{3: 'No sooner had the words been spoken than the hall plunged into darkness, with only the frantic red alerts flashing on the screens.'}
{3: 'Almost everyone rushes out of the hall, hurrying to fix the faltering Babylonia.'}
{3: 'All erroneous codes are sealed within the isolation zone, along with the lost technologies, once again packed into the bottomless black box.'}
{3: 'Turning back, the hall stands deserted once more.'}
{2: 'Teddy', 3: '...Is this the ending you all wanted?'}
{2: 'Teddy', 3: 'Is this... the legacy of the Golden Age, the legacy of Dominik that you sought?'}
{2: 'Teddy', 3: 'All of this... what is it for, really?'}
{2: 'Conservation Area Worker', 3: 'Alert! Alert! Abnormal Punishing Virus concentration detected!'}
{2: 'Conservation Area Worker', 3: 'Everyone, quickly retreat to the Clean Zone!'}
{3: 'Hearing the piercing alarm, all the residents working outside drop their tasks and rush back to the Clean Zone.'}

{3: 'The child, clutching two small pots with seedlings, cannot keep up with the adults and falls hard to the ground. Before a cry can escape, an adult scoops the child up by the collar and hurries back inside the conservation area.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Child', 3: "Elean... my bottle, the one Liv gave me, it's broken...", 4: '2'}
{3: "The child's grubby little hands tightly hold the shattered serum vial."}
{2: 'Elean', 3: "It's okay. We have plenty of other containers. We can replant them.", 4: '1'}
{3: "The gate to the Clean Zone slowly closes, and those who don't make it back in time begin to show red lesions on their skin."}
{2: 'Child', 3: 'Are we going to live like this forever?', 4: '2'}
{3: "She crouches down, gently wiping the tears from the child's face."}
{2: 'Elean', 3: 'But I do know that we need to survive. We have to keep going.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Elean', 3: "One day... one day we'll understand what all of this was for, and why we had to suffer like this.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Elean', 3: 'Right now... we just have to survive. We must survive.', 4: '1'}
{3: 'She pulls the child close in a tight hug.'}
